author: simon johnson
title: Chelsea ready to let Ruben Loftus-Cheek leave on loan with Brighton and West Ham interested
text:
Wednesday 4 January 2017 11:47 BST In demand | Loftus-Cheek could leave Chelsea on loan Duane Burleson/Getty Images 
Chelsea are prepared to let Ruben Loftus‑Cheek leave on loan this month and Brighton have emerged as a shock contender for him. 
West Ham are also in the running for Loftus‑Cheek, who has been earmarked in recent seasons as Chelsea’s best hope of an academy graduate establishing himself in the first team. 
But the 20-year-old midfielder has started just two games — both in the EFL Cup — for new coach Antonio Conte. His only other appearance was as a late substitute in a League game in October. Last term, the England Under-21 international featured 17 times for Chelsea. 
Standard Sport revealed in November the club were considering a loan so he could get regular first-team football . They are already listening to offers and Standard Sport understands Championship leaders Brighton have made an enquiry.
